title: How can the atomic composition and shape of a molecule affect its polarity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Water is a good example. The oxygen is electronegative and the 2 hydrogens are at about 105 degrees. The oxygen causes the 0-H bonds to not be symmetrical, the electron densities are closer to the O than the H so the O part has a slight negative charge, whereas the area of the 2 H’s is slightly positive, so there is charge separation—i.e. polar.
